name: "Annie Warbucks": The Sequel to Annie Trivia Game | Humanities | 25 Questions

questions.text: Who wrote the music to this musical?
questions.explanation:
Charles Strouse.

	Charles Strouse also wrote the music to the original "Annie".

questions.text: This musical was on Broadway.
questions.explanation:
False.

	"Annie" was on Broadway.  The sequel, however, was only on Off-Broadway.

questions.text: Compete this line said by Annie: "Last year I had nothing; this year I have everything, even a new ________."
questions.explanation:
name.

	"I'm Annie Warbucks."

questions.text: Is Miss Hannigan in "Annie Warbucks"?
questions.explanation:
No.

	The orphans explain, "Miss Hannigan is in jail and Annie helped put her there."

questions.text: According to Commissioner Doyle's song, what does Mr. Warbucks think?
questions.explanation:
"You're Above the Law".

	"You, I knew just what your response would be, since you think you're better than her or me."

questions.text: Compete the lyric: "You probably even _____________."
questions.explanation:
jaywalk.

	This line is also from "Above the Law." Commissioner Doyle told Oliver that to keep Annie he has to get married.

questions.text: Compete the lyric: "Changes. Changes happen day and night. One day rainbows, next day ________________."
questions.explanation:
nothing's right.

	Annie doesn't want Oliver to get married.  She says that they don't need a mom to be a family.

questions.text: According to the song "Changes" what is the most improtant question beating down Annie's door?
questions.correct: "Will he need her more than he needs me?"
options: "Will I one day go bald like Daddy Warbucks?"
"Will he find me a good mother?"
questions.explanation:
"Will he need her more than he needs me?".

	"It's scary, shaky, everything is strange, when nothing is certain but change."

questions.text: Where is Grace from?
questions.explanation:
Connecticut & CT.

	According to Annie, Grace is from "someplace close to 5th Avenue...like Connecticut!"

questions.text: What kind of woman does Warbucks need, according to the song "The Kind of Woman"?
options: "Sweet, wonderful and a red head perhaps"
questions.explanation:
"Graceful, charming and a blonde perhaps".

	When they sing this they accentuate "Grace" in "Graceful" and of course Grace is a blonde. Annie decided if she has to have a mother she wants Grace, so she got them all to sing this song to convince Oliver to marry Grace.

questions.text: Who do women from Connecticut "shoot the breeze" with?
questions.explanation:
Chiang Kai-shek.

	At one point in the show, Grace speaks in Chinese and Annie says that it means "Mr. Warbucks can't speak to you now, call back tomorrow."

questions.text: Tesse was going to be adopted, but the couple changed their mind when they saw that Tesse was an older child. What does Tesse say her name would have been?
questions.explanation:
Tesse Jesse.

	Poor Tessy, she was so close to being adopted but it is so hard for older children to get adopted.

questions.text: How old does the ad say Barbara Lee is?
questions.explanation:
43.

	"This ones name is Barbara Lee. Says she's 43, got a PhD, got a face like Rin Tin Tin."

questions.text: Compete the lyric: "She drinks martini, you order _______________."
questions.explanation:
chocolate milk.

	The girls at the orphanage have informed Annie that if Warbucks gets married, Annie will be the second woman in his life.

questions.text: When Annie runs away, what state does she end up in?
questions.explanation:
Tennessee & TN.

	This is where she means Reverend and Mrs. Patterson and CG their daughter.

questions.text: Complete the lyric: "Love can sometimes make you __________."
questions.explanation:
cry.

	"Love can sometimes make you cry, but them's the tears that dry. You've got to open, open wide, let a lot of room inside for love, for love." This is a beautiful song. First Ella Paterson sings it, then Annie and CG sing it together as a duet.

questions.text: Complete this line often said by Alvin T. Patterson: "We're very ________."
questions.explanation:
pleased.

	Alvin says this line many times in the show.

questions.text: What three letters describe what they're going to do to "let out the water when the lands dries up"?
questions.explanation:
TVA.

	The TVA is the Tennessee Valley Authority. It was part of FDR's "New Deal".

questions.text: Complete the lyric: "That's my ___________ shaking the ferry boat."
questions.explanation:
Alvin.

	Alvin does a tap dance number during the song "All Dolled Up".

questions.text: What is Miss Kelley's first name?
questions.explanation:
Florence.

	When they prove that Doyle and Kelley are criminals the orphans say to Mrs. Kelley. "Hello Flo, guess where you're gonna go." Grace is the one who originally heard Doyle call Mrs. Kelley Florence. Doyle tried to cover saying that they were talking about Florence, Italy.

questions.text: Finish the line said by Daddy Warbucks: "I can't get married with you looking like ________________."
questions.explanation:
Commissioner Doyle.

	Annie doesn't trust Mrs. Kelley and doesn't want Warbucks to marry her.

questions.text: How old does Daddy Warbucks say he feels?
questions.explanation:
41.

	Grace: "You're not old Mr. Warbucks, you're as young as you feel."  Warbucks: "Right, and I feel...41."

questions.text: Daddy Warbucks marries Mrs. Kelley.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Daddy Warbucks marries Grace Farro.

questions.text: Complete the lyric: "I always knew, knew that tomorrow would ______________."
questions.explanation:
come true.

	Annie sings the song "I Always Knew" when Molly asks her who would have ever thought they'd all get adopted.

questions.text: Complete the lyric: "I guess the trick is, that you gotta keep _____________."
questions.explanation:
believing.

	"Annie Warbucks", like "Annie", has an excellent theme...Never give up hope because dreams really do come true.
